(a) Authority to request assistance; conditions; notice to Congress
(1) The President, through the Secretary of State, is authorized to request the assistance of a foreign government in obtaining evidence for use in a United States proceeding if he determines that—
(A) the evidence is necessary for the conduct of the proceeding;
(B) the foreign government has jurisdiction over the person or property involved in the proceeding;
(C) the foreign government is able to obtain the evidence; and
(D) the request for assistance is consistent with the foreign policy of the United States.

(b) Assistance; payment
(1) The foreign government may provide assistance in obtaining the evidence pursuant to the request of the United States, and the United States may pay for the costs of such assistance.
(2) The United States may also provide assistance to the foreign government in obtaining evidence for use in a United States proceeding.
(3) The United States may not use any assistance provided under this section to interfere with the political, economic, or social systems or the internal affairs of the foreign country providing the assistance.
(c) Limitation on use of assistance
Assistance provided under this section may not be used for any purpose other than the conduct of the United States proceeding for which it was provided.
(d) Rule of construction
This section shall be construed to provide the President with the authority to request assistance in obtaining evidence for use in a United States proceeding, and to provide assistance to foreign governments in obtaining evidence for use in such a proceeding, only to the extent that such assistance is necessary and appropriate to further important United States foreign policy interests, and is consistent with the foreign policy of the United States.
